TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TextAnchor extends System.Object

summary.span: 表示附註錨定 (Anchor) 的內容選取範圍。

span.span: Represents a selection of content that an annotation is anchored to.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 傳回的物件類型如果您使用 「 自黏便箋及流量或固定格式文件中的反白顯示。 is the object type of the returned if you are using sticky notes and highlights in flow or fixed documents. 中導入[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)]3.5 版。 is introduced in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)] version 3.5. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[版本和相依性](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## Examples 請考慮具有註解 窗格的簡單的文件讀取器應用程式。Consider a simple document reader application that has a comments pane. 註解窗格可能是清單方塊，其中顯示來自錨定到文件之註釋清單的文字。The comments pane might be a list box that displays the text from a list of annotations that are anchored to a document. 如果使用者在清單方塊中選取項目，則應用程式會將對應註釋物件所錨定之文件中的段落帶入檢視。If the user selects an item in the list box, then the application brings into view the paragraph in the document that the corresponding annotation object is anchored to. 下列範例示範如何為這類作為註解窗格的清單方塊實作事件處理常式。The following example demonstrates how to implement the event handler of such a list box that serves as the comments pane. [!code-csharp[FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer#Handler](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#handler)] [!code-vb[FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer#Handler](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#handler)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BoundingEnd As ContentPosition

summary.span: 取得文字錨定的結束位置。

span.span: Gets the end position of the text anchor.
The end position of the text anchor.

summary.span: 取得文字錨定的開頭位置。

span.span: Gets the beginning position of the text anchor.
The beginning position of the text anchor.
